@graph.title: Enterprise and leadership : studies on firms, markets and networks
abstract: 1. The economics of ethical leadership -- 2. Economics and anthropology : reluctant partners -- 3. An entrepreneurial theory of the firm -- 4. Entrepreneurship and the industrial revolution : a re-appraisal -- 5. Marshall on marketing -- 6. Multinational trading companies -- 7. Regional business networks -- 8. The family firm : an analysis of the dynastic motive -- 9. Cultural factors in economic growth

This thoroughly revised and updated new edition of Mark Casson's modern classic The Entrepreneur presents a novel synthesis of the ideas of Joseph Schumpeter, Frank Knight and Friedrich Hayek, according to which the defining characteristic of the entrepreneur is the exercise of judgement in business decisions
